âœ… 1. Windows vs Linux â€” Side-by-Side Comparison

This table shows how the Linux file system compares to Windows.

ğŸ”µ Basic concept

| Windows                            | Linux                                                      |
| ---------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| Uses multiple drives: `C:\`, `D:\` | One single tree starting at `/`                            |
| Files are separated by drive       | Everything is under the root `/`                           |
| System files stored in many places | Clear directory roles (etc = config, bin = commands, etc.) |


ğŸŸ¢ User files

| Windows                               | Linux                                |
| ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| `C:\Users\Alice\Documents`            | `/home/alice/Documents`              |
| Each user has a folder inside `Users` | Each user has a folder inside `home` |
| Admin user: `Administrator`           | Admin user: `root` (home = `/root`)  |


ğŸŸ£ System files

| Windows                                   | Linux                                           |
| ----------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| `C:\Windows`                              | `/usr`, `/etc`, `/bin`, `/lib`                  |
| Registry stores settings                  | Config files in `/etc` (plain text)             |
| System executables: `C:\Windows\System32` | System executables: `/bin`, `/sbin`, `/usr/bin` |


ğŸŸ  Devices

| Windows                  | Linux                                  |
| ------------------------ | -------------------------------------- |
| Disk = `C:\`, `D:\`      | Disk = `/dev/sda`, `/dev/nvme0n1`      |
| USB = drive letters      | USB must be *mounted* (ex: `/mnt/usb`) |
| Devices hidden from user | Devices appear as files in `/dev`      |


ğŸ”´ Temporary & logs

| Windows                 | Linux                          |
| ----------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| Temp: `C:\Windows\Temp` | Temp: `/tmp`                   |
| Logs: Event Viewer      | Logs: `/var/log/` (plain text) |
